Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
CAN: The student may draw basic shapes or symbols representing plants or animals (e.g., circles for animals).
The student may include a single or partial label for a drawing, such as the name of the animal (e.g., 'dog').
CANNOT: The student is likely unable to accurately match specific animals to their correct habitats (e.g., drawing a fish on land).
The student may not show any understanding of the resources plants and animals need to survive (student doesnâ€™t know this).
The student might not illustrate the connection between the animals and their specific environments (e.g., shows no attempt to place animals in context).
The student may fail to portray the interactive system of habitats and resources (e.g., includes animals without any habitat).
